Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالنَّمِيمَةَ فَإِنَّهَا تَزْرَعُ الضَّغِينَةَ وَتُبْعِدُ عَنِ اللَّهِ وَالنَّاسِ
enWisdom: Beware of talebearing, for indeed it plants [the seed of] rancour and distances one from Allah and the people
Whoever believes [the words of] a tattletale spoils his friendship

Wisdom: مَنْ سَعَى بِالنَّمِيمَةِ حَارَبَهُ الْقَرِيبُ وَمَقَتَهُ الْبَعِيدُ
enWisdom: One who seeks to slander [others] by talebearing is fought by the near one and hated by the one who is far [from him]

Wisdom: لَا تَعْجَلَنَّ إِلَى تَصْدِيقِ وَاشٍ وَإِنْ تَشَبَّهَ بِالنَّاصِحِينَ فَإِنَّ السَّاعِيَ ظَالِمٌ لِمَنْ سَعَى بِهِ غَاشٌّ لِمَنْ سَعَى إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Do not be quick in accepting the words of a talebearer, even if he resembles the good advisers, for indeed the slanderer oppresses the one whom he slanders [about] and deceives the one whom he slanders to
Trustworthiness and talebearing do not go together
